title: Calories in a Pork Loin
meta_description: Learn calories in a pork loin with a full nutrition breakdown including protein, fat, carbs, and serving tips for better meals.
assumptions: Boneless, lean pork loin chop, roasted without added fat or seasonings; 100 g portion size for one standard serving.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by cut, fat content, cooking method, and portion size. Check labels or use a scale for accuracy.

quick_answer.text: One 100 g serving of roasted pork loin provides ~143 kcal and 27 g protein.

label_note: Values mirror standard Nutrition Facts labels for easy comparison with packaging.

faqs.q: How many calories in a pork loin per 100 g?
faqs.a: About 143 kcal for roasted, lean boneless pork loin.

faqs.q: What's the protein in a pork loin serving?
faqs.a: Approximately 27 g protein per 100 g serving.
No carbs, fiber, or sugars in plain roasted pork loin.

faqs.q: How does cooking affect calories in pork loin?
faqs.a: Roasting keeps it low-cal; frying or adding fat increases by 40+ kcal per tsp oil.

faqs.q: Is pork loin lean or fatty?
faqs.a: Lean cuts have ~3.5 g fat per 100 g; choose center loin for lowest fat.
